snippet: A $7.3 billion deal between credit card companies and merchants contains a provision that makes it effectively impossible for many merchants to take advantage of it.
abstract: Tentative $7.3 billion deal between credit card companies MasterCard and Visa and merchants contains a provision that makes it effectively impossible for many merchants to take advantage of it; deal would let retailers charge credit customers, but few say they will do it.
lead_paragraph: A $7.3 billion deal between credit card companies and merchants contains a provision that makes it effectively impossible for many merchants to take advantage of it.

headline.seo: Visa and MasterCard Settle Lawsuit, but Merchants Aren’t Happy
headline.main: Visa and MasterCard Settle Lawsuit, but Merchants Aren’t Celebrating
headline.print_headline: Visa and MasterCard Settle Lawsuit, but Merchants Aren’t Celebrating
